title: S.F. City Hall flags lowered to honor Bay Area family lost in Texas floods
description: Marin County residents Mark Walker, 51, and Sara Walker, 50, were staying at a house in Hunt, Tex. with their son Johnny, 14, when the floods hit.
content:
San Francisco officials lowered flags at City Hall Thursday in memory of a Marin County couple and their son who were lost in the deadly flash floods that struck Central Texas in July.

Kentfield residents Mark Walker, 51, and Sara Walker, 50, were staying at their house in Hunt, Tex. with their son Johnny, 14, when the catastrophic floods washed away their home that stood along the Guadalupe River, according to Mark’s mother Kathy Walker.

Their daughter Ellie, 16, was attending summer camp at Camp Waldemar seven miles away, where she remained safe through the storm.

“Mark, Sara and Johnny Walker were cherished members of the San Francisco Bay Area community, and I was heartbroken to hear that they were among those lost in the devastating Texas flooding,” Mayor Daniel Lurie said in a Thursday statement.

“Our city is grieving with them, and today, we are honoring the Walkers and the impact they had on our community,” Lurie added.

Kathy’s younger son, Tyler Walker, was a major league baseball player whose long career spanned five teams, including the San Francisco Giants from 2004 to 2008. Now living in San Rafael, Tyler graduated from San Francisco’s University High School and UC Berkeley before launching his professional baseball career.

Tyler traveled to Texas in the immediate aftermath of the flood to search for his missing family members and to support his niece Ellie.

Mark and Johnny Walker had planned to fly back to the Bay Area just a few days after the flood, with Johnny set to start football practice at Marin Catholic High School as an incoming freshman.

The flash floods resulted in a death toll of over 135, including over 35 children. Dozens were missing for several days following the disaster.

“My family and I are thinking of the Walkers, including their surviving daughter Ellie, as well as their entire community and all those lost in the floods,” Lurie said.
summary: San Francisco officials have lowered flags at City Hall to honor a Marin County couple and their son, Mark Walker, who were lost in the deadly flash floods that hit Central Texas in July. Mark and Sara Walker were staying at their home in Hunt, Tex. when the floods swept away their home. Their daughter, Ellie, 16, was at summer camp seven miles away during the storm. The floods resulted in a death toll of over 135, including over 35 children. Mayor Daniel Lurie expressed his heartbrokenness at the loss of Mark, Sara and Johnny Walker. Tyler Walker's younger son, Tyler Walker, was a major league baseball player whose career spanned five teams, including the San Francisco Giants.
shortSummary: San Francisco officials lowered flags to honor a Marin County couple and son killed in the Texas flash floods, remembering them and their community.
argos_summary: San Francisco officials honored the memory of Mark, Sara, and Johnny Walker, a Marin County family lost in the flash floods in Central Texas in July. The couple and their son were swept away while staying at their home near the Guadalupe River, while their daughter Ellie was safe at summer camp. Mayor Daniel Lurie expressed the city's grief and recognized the impact the Walkers had on the community, as the floods resulted in over 135 fatalities, including many children.
